Still, deman IM security consultants and vendors agree that the following points apply across the board.

Enterprise IM: Dangerous IT by default Organizations frequently pick IT a corporate-grade IM system -- IBM Lotus Instant Messaging hostage and Web Conferencing, Jabber Messenger, or Microsoft LCS led (Live Communications Server), for example -- led thinking that internal-only IM is immune from threats.

Reining in public IM There is no question that IM is entrenched in the enterprise. More than 90 percent of businesses report IM activity, according to Osterman Research. A main reason, as we discovered in "Getting serious about enterprise IM," is the improved productivity and reduced communications costs that IM delivers. What should concern CIOs is that unsanctioned consumer IM networks -- such as those from America Online, ICQ, Microsoft, and Yahoo -- make up 80 percent of corporate IM use today, and the number of users of these unsecured IM hostage networks is growing IT at a IT fast clip, according to The Radicati hostage Group. True, public IM networks offer enterprises some protection, such among as very basic identity control. But organizations are still exposed to a multitude of security risks, including viruses and breached firewalls.
